description.value: Runs a query on a DB and counts the returned rows

property.label: SQL Type
property.description: The type of SQL server this monitor is connecting to

property.label: SQL Port
property.description: SQL Port to use on the SQL Server

property.label: Database
property.description: Name of the database to connect to on the sql server

property.label: URL
property.description: The URL to use to connect to the databse, instead of dynamically constructing the URL from the database, server, port, etc.

property.label: SQL Statement
property.description: SQL Statement to execute on the SQL database. The returned rows of this statement will be used for the monitor.

property.label: Windows Logon
property.description: If checked, the program will use windows single sign-on

property.label: SQL Username
property.description: Username to use for login to the database

property.label: SQL Password
property.description: Password for the username used to connect to the sql database

property.label: Query Timeout
property.description: The query timeout, in seconds. 0 to have no timeout

property.label: Match Content
property.description: If this box is checked you can compare the value of the top row of a specific column to a constant value

property.label: Match Column Name
property.description: The name of the column to compare

property.label: Match Value
property.description: The value, which can be a regular expression, to compare the column to

property.label: Capture Column Data
property.description: If this box is checked you can capture the value of the top row of a specific column. ****WARNING - The datatype of the column must be numeric!****

property.label: Query Name
property.description: A unique name describing this query.

property.label: Column Name
property.description: The name of the column you wish to capture.

property.label: Column Name 2
property.description: The name of the column you wish to capture.

property.label: Column Name 3
property.description: The name of the column you wish to capture.

property.label: Column Name 4
property.description: The name of the column you wish to capture.

property.label: Column Name 5
property.description: The name of the column you wish to capture.

property.label: Column Name 6
property.description: The name of the column you wish to capture.

property.label: Column Name 7
property.description: The name of the column you wish to capture.

property.label: Column Name 8
property.description: The name of the column you wish to capture.

property.label: Column Name 9
property.description: The name of the column you wish to capture.

property.label: Column Name 10
property.description: The name of the column you wish to capture.

property.label: Schema
property.description: Specify a different Schema for use with the connection.

property.label: Schema Value
property.description: The schema to use when connecting to the DB2 instance.

metric.name: Response Time
metric.description: The amount of time to connect to the database and execute the query, in milliseconds. 0 if call didn't successfully complete

metric.name: Connect Response Time
metric.description: The amount of time to connect to the database only, in milliseconds. 0 if call didn't successfully complete

metric.name: Query Response Time
metric.description: The amount of time to execute the query only, in milliseconds. 0 if call didn't successfully complete

metric.name: Row Count
metric.description: Number of rows returned in the query

metric.name: DB Connection
metric.description: Returns a 1 if the DB connection was successful and a 0 if the DB connection failed.

metric.name: Column Value
metric.description: The value of the captured column.

metric.name: Content Verified
metric.description: 1 if the specified column name matches the requested column value; 0 if the value doesn't match or no match was requested
